item.description:
Thursday, June 12, 2025

Thursday, June 12, 2025 is the last day to withdraw from regular Spring 2025 classes.

Students may withdraw online through MyClark@ctcLink until 11:59 p.m.

Withdraw dates for unusual start and/or end date classes vary; contact the Enrollment Services office for details.

item.title: ODEI Student Graduation
item.description:
Penguin Union Building 161 - Student Lounge
Thursday, June 12, 2025, 11:30am – 1pm

Systemically non-dominant students (students of color, queer students, and students with disabilities) of Clark College and their families or support systems are invited to attend our annual Diversity Center Graduation Reception. Let’s honor the hard work of our graduates and uplift the support given by family and communities. 

You are invited to participate, support, and/or celebrate students at this event.



Organization: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
Organizer: MLaw@clark.edu
Event Locator: 2024-AANQPL
Web Area Keywords: ODEIstudent

item.description:

item.title: AA-DTA Exploratory Group Advising
item.description:
Scarpelli Hall 018 - Classroom Computer Lab
Thursday, June 12, 2025, 4 – 5:30pm

Join your peers to learn how to make the most of the AA-DTA (Associate of Arts, Direct Transfer Agreement). Exploratory advisors will review degree requirements and support you as you create your next term schedule. For a long-term plan, we recommend scheduling an individual 45-minute advising meeting. Email exploratoryadv@clark.edu with any questions.

Registration is required



Organization: Advising
Organizer: JSavage@clark.edu
Event Locator: 2025-AAPJSB

item.title: Minecraft and Sonic 3 Movie Night
item.description:
Gaiser Hall 150 - Student Center
Thursday, June 12, 2025, 5:30 – 9pm

The Activities Programming Board will be showing the movies A Minecraft Movie (PG) and Sonic the Hedgehog 3 (PG) on Thursday, June 12th in Gaiser Student Center starting at 5:30 PM.

Bring your friends and family and enjoy a fun time together! There will be free pizza and drinks while supplies last! The movie will include closed captioning. Questions? Please contact Austyn at afuerstenberg@clark.edu.



Organization: APB
Organizer: slelo@clark.edu
Web Area Keywords: StudentLife, penguindigest
Event Locator: 2025-AAPFLF

item.title: Clark College Orchestra - Grand Finale
item.description:
Offsite Event
Sunday, June 15, 2025, 3 – 5pm

The Clark College Orchestra perform Grand Finale on Sunday, June 15, 3pm at Skyview HS, 1300 NW 139th St, Vancouver.  This will be the final concert with Music Director and Conductor Dr. Don Appert as he retires from Clark on June 30.  The orchestra performs Puccini Arias with soloist Linda Appert and Rachmanioff's Symphony No. 2.  A celebration reception will be held following the performance.



Organization: SOFA
Organizer: SJWilliams@clark.edu
Web Area Keywords: musicconcerts
Event Locator: 2025-AAPKXT

item.title: Commencement Ceremony
item.description:
Offsite Event
Wednesday, June 18, 2025, 6:30 – 8:30pm

On Wednesday, June 18, Clark College will honor its 89th graduating class at the 2025 Clark College Commencement ceremony. The ceremony will take place in-person at 6:30 p.m. at the Cascades Amphitheater.

The Cascades Amphitheater is located at 17200 NE Delfel Road in Ridgefield, WA.  Gates will open at 5pm.

Tickets are not required to attend.  Please check the Commencement webpage for updates www.clark.edu/go/grad. 

Clark College expressly prohibits discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, age, perceived or actual physical or mental disability, pregnancy, genetic information, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, creed, religion, honorably discharged veteran or military status, citizenship, immigration status, or use of a trained guide dog or service animal in its programs and activities. Learn more at www.clark.edu/nds. If you need an accommodation due to a disability in order to fully participate in this event, please contact Clark College’s Human Resources Office. Phone: 360-992-2105 Email: hr@clark.edu



Organization: Office of the President
Organizer: mgolder@clark.edu
Web Area Keywords: penguindigest
Event Locator: 2024-AANPHX

item.title: NursingCAS Information Sessions
item.description:
Virtual
Thursday, June 26, 2025, 4 – 5pm

The Nursing Centralized Application Service (NursingCAS) streamlines the application process for prospective nursing students, allowing you to apply to multiple programs through one platform. Join Clark College’s healthcare advisors for a step-by-step walkthrough of the NursingCAS application process, and guidance on meeting Clark’s program requirements.

Zoom Link: NursingCAS Information Session

item.title: Summer 2025 Waitlist Ends at 1:00 p.m.
item.description:
Friday, June 27, 2025, 1 – 11:59pm

The Summer 2025 waitlist will update for the last time at 1:00 p.m. on Friday, June 27, 2025.

Students should confirm whether they have been enrolled in classes for which they were waitlisted by viewing their schedule online through MyClark@ctcLink, beginning on June 28, 2025.

Students may begin overloading classes with instructor permission on Monday, June 30, 2025. Contact the instructor to request a Class Permission code in order to add classes online.

Questions, please email us at: enroll@clark.edu or call 360-992-2183.



Organization: Enrollment Services
Organizer: nmaruca@clark.edu
Web Site: www.clark.edu…

item.title: Summer 2025 Faculty Consent Required to Register for Classes
item.description:
Wednesday, July 9, 2025

Beginning Wednesday, July 9, 2025 faculty consent is required to register in all Summer 2025 regular-start-date classes, even if spots are available.

Students should contact the instructor to request a Class Permission code in order to add classes online.

Students may register for open, LATE-start-date classes (classes that don't start in first week of the term) without faculty consent.

Questions, please email us at: enroll@clark.edu or call 360-992-2183.



Organization: Enrollment Services
Organizer: nmaruca@clark.edu

Event Locator: 2025-AANWWS

item.description:
Sunday, July 13, 2025

Students may drop classes online until 11:59 p.m., on Sunday, July 13, and receive a 100% refund of tuition and fees for Summer 2025, for regular-start classes.

Refund dates for unusual start and/or end date classes vary; contact the Enrollment Services office for details.

Questions, please email us at: enroll@clark.edu or call 360-992-2183.

item.title: Summer 2025 Enrollment Verification Available
item.description:
Thursday, July 17, 2025

Students may obtain an official enrollment verification for the Summer 2025 term online through National Student Clearinghouse. Instructions can be found here: http://www.clark.edu/enroll/registration/enrollment_verification.php

If the online official Enrollment Verification will not be sufficient for your purposes, you may email your request to enroll@clark.edu after the 10th day of the term.

Questions, please email us at: enroll@clark.edu or call 360-992-2183.

item.description:
Saturday, July 26, 2025

Saturday, July 26, 2025 is the last day to withdraw from regular-start classes for a 50% refund of tuition and fees for Summer 2025 term.

Students may withdraw from classes online through MyClark@ctcLink until 11:59 p.m.

Refund dates for unusual start and/or end date classes vary; contact the Enrollment Services office for details.

Questions, please email us at: enroll@clark.edu or call 360-992-2183.

item.title: Say Hey! Clark College
item.description:
Penguin Union Building 161 - Student Lounge
Wednesday, August 6, 2025, 4:30 – 8:30pm

Say Hey! is the largest multi-cultural networking event in Oregon and southwest Washington. Each quarter, Partners in Diversity connects local businesses and community members with professionals of color who recently relocated to Oregon or southwest Washington. Recently relocated professionals of color (aka Honorees) are introduced during a special portion of the program. 

We help build community, deepen connections and create an environment where everyone is welcomed. Employers can leverage this program as an extension to your onboarding experiences for new staff of color. A study on workforce retention commissioned by Partners in Diversity and released in 2020 showed that having a strong, supportive community is an important element in retaining professionals of color in Oregon and southwest Washington. 

Say Hey! events take place every year in February, May, August and November. It is free and open to professionals of color and allies.

Please note this is a 21+ event. 



Organization: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
Organizer: apereira@clark.edu
Event Locator: 2024-AANSPL

item.title: Fall 2025 Waitlist Ends at 1:00 p.m.
item.description:
Friday, September 12, 2025, 1 – 11:59pm

The Fall 2025 waitlist will update for the last time at 1:00 p.m. on Friday, September 12, 2025.

Students should confirm whether they have been enrolled in classes for which they were waitlisted by viewing their schedule online through MyClark@ctcLink, beginning on September 13, 2025.

Students may begin overloading classes with instructor permission on Monday, September 15, 2025. Contact the instructor to request a Class Permission code in order to add classes online.

Questions, please email us at: enroll@clark.edu or call 360-992-2183.

item.title: Fall 2025 Faculty Consent Required to Register for Classes
item.description:
Wednesday, September 24, 2025

Beginning Wednesday, September 24, faculty consent is required to register in all Fall 2025 regular-start-date classes, even if spots are available.

Students should contact the instructor to request a Class Permission code in order to add classes online.

Students may register for open, LATE-start-date classes (classes that don't start in first week of the term) without faculty consent.

Questions, please email us at: enroll@clark.edu or call 360-992-2183.

item.title: Winter 2026 and/or Spring 2026 PRIORITY Registration begins
item.description:
Virtual
Monday, November 10, 2025

Online registration for Priority registration begins on Monday, November 10, 2025 for Winter 2026 term and/or Spring 2026 term.

Once published, your enrollment appointment date and time can be found in ctcLink. Log in to MyClark@ctcLink, click on Manage Classes, then click on Enrollment Dates to find out your enrollment appointment date.

In order to register for classes, you will need to activate and log in to your MyClark@ctcLink account.  Visit https://ptprd.ctclink.us/psp/ptprd/?cmd=login and select First Time User to activate your new account. Be sure to write down your ctcLink ID number when it is displayed on the screen.

If you need further assistance with activating and/or logging in to your account, please contact the TechHub at 360-992-2010, or TechHub@clark.edu

Enrollment Services: enroll@clark.edu or 360-992-2183 or connect with our services via Zoom: https://www.clark.edu/its/documentation-and-resources/students/virtual-assistance.php.



Organization: Enrollment Services
Organizer: nmaruca@clark.edu
Event Locator: 2025-AAPAGW

item.title: Winter 2026 and/or Spring 2026 Registration BEGINS for Degree Seeking Students
item.description:
Virtual
Wednesday, November 12, 2025

From November 12, 2025 through November 18, 2025, degree seeking students begin registering for Winter 2026 term and/or Spring 2026 term.  

Once published, your enrollment appointment date and time can be found in ctcLink.  Log in to MyClark@ctcLink, click on Manage Classes, then click on Enrollment Dates to find out your enrollment appointment date.

Degree Seeking students may begin registering online for Winter 2026 term and/or Spring 2026 term, as long as they have completed admissions, Student Orientation, and any potential advising requirements.

Students returning after four terms or more, need to submit a new admission application to Clark College through the state-wide admission application.

In order to register for classes, you will need to activate and log in to your MyClark@ctcLink account.  Visit https://ptprd.ctclink.us/psp/ptprd/?cmd=login and select First Time User to activate your new account. Be sure to write down your ctcLink ID number when it is displayed on the screen.

If you need further assistance with activating and/or logging in to your account, please contact the TechHub at 360-992-2010, or TechHub@clark.edu

Enrollment Services: enroll@clark.edu or 360-992-2183 or connect with our services via Zoom: https://www.clark.edu/its/documentation-and-resources/students/virtual-assistance.php.
